attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description:
Produces a string of properties in inline-style fashion
This function is supposed to be added to prototypes of different objects.
It takse into consideration only properties, methods are ignored.
If attribite value is a number, the measurement unit will be appended.

params.name: style
params.description: string of label-value pairs or object.

return.description: a concatenation of substrings; each substring is of this format: "attribute: value;".

example: The return value is of the form: "padding: 0px;margin: 10px;color: #ababab;"

helpers.name: helpers
helpers.description:
transforms each element of the input array into a non-negative number.
If an element is negative, its absolute value is used.
If an element fails to be converted to a number, it is substituted by zero.

params.name: arr
params.description: Array      array of numbers

String.name: String
String.description:
Transforms a row-html string into a Row object. It is supposed that the string to process is of the
following form: <tr ... > ... </tr>. Inside the tag, there might be elements "td" that will be
processed one by one by function String::createCellFromHtml().

Style.name: Style
Style.description: This class is supposed to characterize inline styles of html tags.

params.name: style
params.description: string of label-value pairs or object.

BorderStyle.name: BorderStyle
BorderStyle.description: Styles specific for the table border.

Attributes.name: Attributes
Attributes.description: This class is supposed to define attributes of html tags

params.name: attr
params.description: a string or object from which this object properties are to be created.

Cell.name: Cell
Cell.description: Represents a table cell. The argument is supposed to be passed to the "content" property.

Content.name: Content
Content.description: This class is used to encompass other objects.

ListItem.name: ListItem
ListItem.description: This class is used to represent a list item.

List.name: List
List.description: This class is used to represent ordered and unordered lists.

createRowFromHtml.name: createRowFromHtml
createRowFromHtml.description:
Transforms a row-html string into a Row object. It is supposed that the string to process is of the
following form: <tr ... > ... </tr>. Inside the tag, there might be elements "td" that will be
processed one by one by function String::createCellFromHtml().

createTableFromHtml.name: createTableFromHtml
createTableFromHtml.description:
Creates an object representation from a string that is an html repersentation of a table.
Only one table is supposed to be processed at a time, so the string to be processed is to
be of the following form <table ...> ... </table>. Inside the tag, there should be tags "tr"
that will be processed one by one by function String::createRowFromHtml().

isFramedTable.name: isFramedTable
isFramedTable.description:
Returns true, if tableHtml is an html code corresponding to a table each row of which
contains just one cell, and this cell in its turn contains only one table.
Returns false otherwise.

classitems.description:
returns object with keys 'width', 'color', 'style' describing the border.
If the Style object has 'border-style' equal to 'none', then in the
return object, the key 'width' is set to 0.
If 'border-style' is not 'none' and 'border-width' is present, then in the
return object, the key 'width' the 'border-width' value.
Otherwise, the 'width' key is not present.
border width in px
classitems.name: border-width

classitems.description: border style. Possible values: none, solid, dotted etc.
classitems.name: border-style

classitems.description:
border color. In case one wants black color, one should use a color maximally close to the black (e.g. #000001)
otherwise some web browsers (e.g. GMail) will remove it and substitute it with its own one.

It is better to use with an integer argument.

value of the width. Supposed to be either a string (i.e. "10px", "14.1em" etc)
or a number (i.e. 200, 10).

Gets the width of the cell as it is present in the style property. It tends to return a number:
if it is measured in "px", then the measurment unit is removed and the number is returned.

classitems.name: length

classitems.description: Gets the element with index "pos". If it does not exist, null is returned.

classitems.description: Gets the first element. Delegates to Content::getElem(0)
classitems.name: getFirst

classitems.description: Gets the last element. Delegates to Content::getElem()
classitems.name: getLast

classitems.description: Appends the element to the array Content::elements.

Inserts element at position pos inside the array of elements. If the lenght of array "elements"
is equal to N, than the allowed position index is inside the range [0, 1, ..., N]. If the given
position index is outside that range, an error is thrown. If the position index is equal to N
(that corresponds to appending the element), then Content::appendElem is called.
classitems.name: insertElem

classitems.description: Appends element to the array of Content::elements.
classitems.name: appendElem

classitems.description:
Drops the element at the given position and returns it. If element at the position does not exist,
an error is thrown.
classitems.name: dropElemAt

classitems.description: Transforms the object into html form.  If item of the "elements" property is of Object type, then it should have "toHtml" method which is to be applied to the item.
classitems.name: toHtml

classitems.description:
Converts the first letter of the string into the upper case
If the string is empty, the output is empty string as well.

params.name: str
params.description: String

classitems.description:
Converts the first letter of the string into the upper case
If the string is empty, the output is empty string as well.

params.name: str
params.description: String

classitems.description:
Replaces special characters present in the input string by their unicodes. It is supposed to replace symbols like à, ò, è, é
and not a, b, c etc. For the moment it replaces any characters which unicode is outside the range [32, 125].

Splits array element at position "pos" in two parts in such a way that the trace of the original array
is equal to the trace of the output array. If it is the first element of the array to be splitted, then
it is splitted in 1/2 and 1/2 (up to the truncation). If the element has a left neighbour, then the neighbour
and the element are taken off 1/3 and these two parts are given to the newly created element that is inserted
between the neighbour and the element: [a, b, ...] -> [2/3 a, 1/3 (a + b), 2/3 b, ...]

params.name: arr
params.description: array of integers

params.name: pos
params.description: index of the element, before which an element will be inserted

classitems.description:
Sandwiches the midlle string with the left and the right ones. If the middle one is empty, empty string is returned.
If the right arguments is not given, the left one is used.
Glues all elements of the array, replace trailing spaces and repaces multiple spaces with a single one.

params.name: glue
params.description: glue string

classitems.description: Merge two objects. If non-object is given, an error is thrown.
Create key-value caches of limited size

return.description:
Returns the Object data after storing it on itself with
	property name the (space-suffixed) string and (if the cache is larger than Expr.cacheLength)
	deleting the oldest entry

classitems.description:
Inserts the item at the given position. If the list contains N items, then allowed index for the
item to be inserted at is the range [0, N]. Zero index corresponds to insertion at the beginning of the list,
N - to the end of the list, that is to appending (delegates to List::appendItem). If the index is out
of this range, an error is thrown. If the item to be inserted is not an instance of ListItem,
an error is thrown.

It is better to use with an integer argument.

params.name: w
params.description: value of the width. Supposed to be either a string (i.e. "10px", "14.1em" etc) or a number (i.e. 200, 10).

classitems.name: setCellWidths

params.name: profile
params.description: each elements if this array is a width of the corresp. cell in the row.

classitems.description:
Inserts a cell "cell" into position "pos" of the row.
After insertion, the row length increases by 1. Therefore, "pos"
is the index with which the cell is referenced in the row after insertion.
classitems.name: insertCellAt

classitems.description: Append a cell to the row cells. If one tries to append a non-Cell object, an exception is thrown.
classitems.name: appendCell

params.name: cell
params.description: a cell to be appended.

classitems.description:
Drops the cell in the row. If the cell is utmost left, the freed space is then
assigned to its right neighbour:
|xxx| a | b   | c | -> |     a | b   | c |
| a |xxx| b   | c | -> | a |     b   | c |
If there is no right neighbour, then it is assigned to the left one:
| a | b | c | xxx | -> | a | b | c       |
If a cell to delete does not exist, nothing is performed.
classitems.name: dropCell

params.name: cellNum
params.description: cell number to delete. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description: Gives the number of cells in the row.
classitems.name: cellNum

classitems.description: Appends style to the cell of the row.

params.name: cellNum
params.description: cell number to which the style is to be appended.

params.name: stl
params.description: style or object to be appended

classitems.description: Generates row-specific html code with corresponding attributes and styles. Creation of the cell-related html of each cell is delegated to Cell::toHtml()
classitems.name: toHtml

classitems.description:
Populates the attributes from a string that is an html repersentation of some row.
It takes a string that is an html representation of a row and update current object
parameters such that it will correspond to the html representation.
In other words, (new Row()).loadFromHtml(htmlString).toHtml() should be similar to htmlString
(eventually up to presence/absence of some parameters and attributes).
classitems.name: loadFromHtml

classitems.description: Drops inline attribute named attrName from DOM element

params.name: element
params.description: an inline attribute of  this element will be dropped. The element should respond to jQuery "attr" method.

params.name: attrName
params.description: this attribute name will be dropped.

classitems.description:
Inserts table and applies hover effect on it.
It is based on CKEDITOR.editor.insertElement() method.
This approach might be wrong but I wanted to avoid repetitions.
Type of the object. Returns "Table" for the objects of this type.
classitems.name: getType

classitems.description: Imposes attributes of the row
classitems.name: setAttr

classitems.description: Attributes of the table.
classitems.name: attr

classitems.description: Imposes style of the row
classitems.name: setStyle

classitems.description: Array of rows constituting the table or empty array

classitems.name: appendRow

classitems.description: Retrieves the value of property from the "style"
classitems.name: styleProperty

params.name: prop
params.description: property name which value should be retrieved

classitems.description:
Gives a two-dimensional array [[w_11, w_12, ..., w_1n], ..., [w_m1, w_m2, ..., w_m3]]
where w_ij is width of the cell located in the row i and column j.
classitems.name: getMatrix

classitems.description:
Returns array of widths of the cells in the table rows if all rows
have the same cell widths. Otherwise Null is returned.
classitems.name: getProfile

classitems.description: Imposes the widths of all cell in all rows of the table. The operation is delegated to a row methods.
classitems.name: setProfile

params.name: profile
params.description: an array of cell widths that will be applied to each row.

classitems.description:
Inserts a cell "cell" into a given position "pos" of each row of the table.
If the table has 5 columns, then after insertion it will have 5+1=6 columns.
Position "pos" will correspond to the index of the inserted cell in the row after insertion.
"pos" must be a valid cell number into the table after insertion. So, for the example above,
the valid values for "pos" are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.
classitems.name: insertColumnAt

classitems.description: Drops specified column from the table. The operation is delegated to the Row::dropCell()
classitems.name: dropColumn

params.name: colNum
params.description: the number of the column to delete. Numeration starts with 0.

classitems.description:
Gives the number of columns in the table or null if not all rows have the same number of cells.
The operation is delegated to the Row::cellNum().
classitems.name: colNum

classitems.description: Whether all rows in the table have the same cell widths.
classitems.name: sameWidth

return.description: true, if all rows have the same cells' widths, false otherwise.

classitems.description:
Set the border of the table. It updates the properties 'attr' and 'style' of the instance:
1. in 'style' property, sets up the following properties: 'border-width', 'border-color' and 'border-style'
2. in 'attr' property, sets up 'border' property.
Note that if after setting the border there is an assigment of 'style' or 'attr' property, then some info about the border might be overwritten.
classitems.name: setBorder

params.name: borderInfo
params.description: Object containing 'width', 'color' and 'style' fo the border to set.

classitems.default: border-width is set to 1, border-color is set to #000000, border-style is set to solid.

classitems.description:
Removes the border of the table. It updates the properties 'attr' and 'style' of the instance:
1. in 'style' property, deletes the properties: 'border-width', 'border-color' and sets up 'border-style' to 'none'
2. in 'attr' property, deletes 'border' property.
classitems.name: removeBorder

classitems.description:
Gives true if all table rows have border around (that is, each row is nothing but a table with border)
false otherwise. It at least one of the properties, corresponding to the "bogus" elements is set, then
the table is considered as being framed and hence all its rows will be framed.
classitems.name: isFramed

return.description: true if all table rows have border around

classitems.description: Deletes properties that are responsable for the frames around the table rows.

Appends the style to the column. If the column exists, the method call Row::appendStyleToCell()
on each of the table rows.
classitems.name: appendStyleToCol

params.name: colNum
params.description: column number to which the style is to be appended.

params.name: style
params.description: Style or Object to be appended

classitems.description:
Generates table-specific html code with corresponding attributes and styles.
Creation of the row-related html of each row is delegated to Row::toHtml()
classitems.name: toHtml

classitems.description:
Style of the row containing a single cell. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the row containing a single cell. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Style of the  the cell which fills the whole row. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the  the cell which fills the whole row. It is used to created to a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Style of the  the table that will be inserted into the single cell to create a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

classitems.description:
Attributes of the  the table that will be inserted into the single cell to create a table with framed lines.
It is supposed that all properties
bogusRowStyle, bogusRowAttr, bogusCellStyle, bogusCellAttr, bogusTableStyle, bogusTableAttr
are simultaneously null or set.
classitems.name: bogusTableStyle

If the string is empty, the output is empty string as well.

Missing item type
Replaces special characters present in the input string by their unicodes. It is supposed to replace symbols like à, ò, è, é
and not a, b, c etc. For the moment it replaces any characters which unicode is outside the range [32, 125].

Missing item type
Splits array element at position "pos" in two parts in such a way that the trace of the original array
is equal to the trace of the output array. If it is the first element of the array to be splitted, then
it is splitted in 1/2 and 1/2 (up to the truncation). If the element has a left neighbour, then the neighbour
and the element are taken off 1/3 and these two parts are given to the newly created element that is inserted
between the neighbour and the element: [a, b, ...] -> [2/3 a, 1/3 (a + b), 2/3 b, ...]

Missing item type
Sandwiches the midlle string with the left and the right ones. If the middle one is empty, empty string is returned.
If the right arguments is not given, the left one is used.

Missing item type
Glues all elements of the array, replace trailing spaces and repaces multiple spaces with a single one.

Missing item type
Merge two objects. If non-object is given, an error is thrown.

Missing item type
Create key-value caches of limited size

Missing item type

Missing item type

Missing item type
Adds the same handler for all of the specified attrs

Missing item type
